attributes.action: order new electric trains for the East Coast Main Line, electrify the Edinburgh-Aberdeen and Leeds-York lines, and cancel the diesel Intercity Express Programme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
National Express East Coast (NXEC) has to use ‘Intercity 125’ diesel train sets on many services that don't leave the electrified East Coast Main Line – trains that terminate at Leeds, Newcastle or Edinburgh.

Its 29 electric sets (Intercity 225s) are not enough. This is a waste of electrified lines.

And the diesel/electric hybrid Intercity Express Programme/HST2 to replace NXEC’s fleet should be cancelled. Increasing oil prices and the extra weights of the diesel engine and batteries make the concept uneconomic.

Electrifying Edinburgh-Aberdeen and Leeds-York routes would almost eliminate NXEC’s diesel workings.

Instead of HST2, electric 140mph Class 395s could be ordered. 26x 6-car sets are being built for South Eastern Trains, to run in 2009.

Each vehicle costs £1.6 million.

Adding up to 12x 10-car sets (costing £192 million) to the existing order would replace the diesels, and retain the existing production line, making it cheaper. The need to design a completely new train will vanish.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
